programs.name: Cottage Housing Development Standards
programs.outcome: Allowed cottage housing as permitted use in single-family zones with density bonuses for smaller units

programs.name: Cottage Housing Regulations
programs.outcome: Permitted cottage clusters in residential zones

studies.title: Pocket Neighborhoods: Creating Small-Scale Community in a Large-Scale World
studies.finding: Book documenting pocket neighborhood design principles and case studies - primary source but practitioner-authored, not peer-reviewed research

examples.description: Third Street Cottages - 8 cottages around shared commons, designed by Ross Chapin Architects
examples.source: Ross Chapin Architects portfolio - needs verification

examples.description: Multiple pocket neighborhood projects in greater Seattle area

notes: IMPORTANT: I was unable to access web search to verify this information. The evidence provided is based on my training knowledge but could not be fact-checked against current sources. Key limitations: (1) No verified statistics on social outcomes or resident satisfaction, (2) Most documented examples come from one architect/firm (Ross Chapin) in one region (Pacific Northwest), (3) Limited peer-reviewed academic research on pocket neighborhoods specifically, (4) Municipal code citations need verification. The concept has a clear origin point and documented examples, but independent evaluation of outcomes is sparse. Recommend conducting actual web searches to verify all claims and find current data.
